alert.note: Alert for Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:00PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MOORE COUNTY... At 559 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Biscoe, or 13 miles east of Troy, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Carthage, Robbins, Highfalls, Eagle Springs and Glendon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
